response:
in germany, protecting personal information is considered very important. the gdpr law is implemented here and companies have to ensure that they are compliant with it. companies have to make sure that they only collect the necessary information and use it only for the purpose it was collected. they also need to inform users about what information they collect and how long they store it. users can request that their data be deleted or ask for a copy of the stored information. the law also includes provisions on how companies have to handle potential data breaches and what actions they have to take in case of an incident. in general, germans are very careful with their personal data and expect companies to treat it with care.</s> 
how do you think german culture and societal values influence the way the country approaches data privacy?</s>
